I thought you’d find it interesting. I ♥ [Typowiki](http://web.archive.org/web/20150422205633/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Typowiki).

\> _Which is the most historically accurate version of Garamond?_

The metal one made by Claude Garamond himself, back in the mid-1500s.

Now if you're looking for a digital version of it, [Garamond Premier Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20150422205633/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/P/P_1737.html) is by far the best revival of it, in my opinion.

Although some would argue that the typeface [1530 Garamond](http://web.archive.org/web/20150422205633/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/tiro/1530-garamond/) by Tiro is a very good version of the "original".

I love 1530 Garamond. I've been waiting for the right application so I can buy it, but so far no luck.

Just look at its 'Q'. Beautiful.
